result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Striepling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: NOTE: The defendant may NOT terminate probation early.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $14,409.87.  Defendant is to pay 1/3 of the restitution owed to the victim up front (1/3 of $1,780.87).  $593.62 has been paid and disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Courts office. Defendant's right to challenge the restitution claim of the insurance companies in the amount of $12,629.00 is reserved.
----------------------------
AMENDMENT - 7-27-2015 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED PURSUANT TO ORDER DENYING RESTITUTION that the restitution amount is set at zero for Integrity Insurance and Casualty Recovery Solutions.
----------------------------

No contact with the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent. No contact with AEK without Agent approval. No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION RULES, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
----------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete one-hundred (100) hours of community service work during his period of probation with NO BUYOUT.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH STEVEN W. GRUNEWALD OR HIS RESIDENCE.
